response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getKey() + ":" + it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getKey() method of the DataSnapshot object to get the key of the current object and the getValue() method to get the value. Then you can concatenate them to get the string representation of the key and value for each object separately.
